Although this game scares the shizzz out of me, I still cannot get enough. The objective is quite clear, the characters all have their own unique personality and story, and the killers are absolutely terrifying. I only wish that there was not a shared "bloodpoints" system between characters but that is just a personal preference off of my play style.

Esse é um dos melhores jogos que já joguei, apesar de parecer simples, exige um grande nível de habilidade a diversidade de personagens e habilidades permite você criar uma Build unica para cada partida tanto para sobrevivente como de assassino, então cada partida pode ser imprevisível dependendo da forma como a equipe forma sua Build. os mapas também apresentam uma forma randômica de distribuir os geradores, totens, baus e o porão, assim mesmo caindo em um mapa já conhecido, você terá que procurar todos esses itens como se estive-se explorando o mapa pela primeira vez. Apesar de existir alguns personagens que são pagos com dinheiro real, as habilidades desses personagens sempre ficam disponíveis na loja do jogo semanalmente com a opção de serem compradas com dinheiro do próprio game (sem gasta dinheiro real) o que permite você progredir no game sem demais gastos, e a opção de ter os personagens de dlcs passa a ser apenas com questão visual.

o sistema de divisão por ranking é interessante, mas ainda é falho, muitas vezes você está no rank 10 e acaba caindo contra jogadores do rank 1, o que parece ser um pouco desbalanceado, mas no geral muitas vezes isso não interfere na jogabilidade da partida, já que muitas vezes o nível do rank não reflete realmente o nível de habilidade dos jogadores.

The first thing I would like to say about DBD is that this game is the only one that can somehow be called an esports in its genre. There have been attempts to give us games with a larger map, graphics and mechanics closer to real life, but this was all unnecessary. Dead by daylight conquered everyone with its simplicity. What can be difficult for a maniac to kill his victims, and the victims, in turn, do not get caught by the maniac and start the generators? That's right - everything is simple and ingenious.

But the game has significant drawbacks:
1. Bugs, bugs, bugs and more bugs - When hanging in the basement, you appear above it; you can get stuck in the closet that even the killer won't get you out, but the fact that a nurse can teleport into the hill is a separate story altogether. I'm sure everyone can talk about their experience with bugs.
2. Skills. Some perks for both the maniac and the survivor are useless, probably from the very release of the DBD. And as I understand it, they are not going to do anything in the near future.
3. Completely dead feedback and reports. I think that everyone at least once came across at least one category that is described in the report. What's the point in reporting, if there is no feedback, the person played and will continue to play. It's good if it is unsportsmanlike behavior (as some camping and tunneling believe), but if you play with a cheater, then you don't even need to write a report.

In general, the game can be played if you are not afraid to burn a little. KEKW
只能說，多一點人來玩，來揪你的夥伴一起玩然後砍爆他，超級好玩!

I am going to be honest this game is not horrible but its also not great.
The game has quite a big learning curb and can be seen as the dark souls of the asymmetric gaming universe. 
The match making is straight up non-existent and you can be expected to die more than you will survive.
Overall the graphics and overall game play is good (obviously filled with some game breaking bugs) but its the matchmaking and camping done by killers that really spoils the fun of the game.

Myself and a few friends have spent several hours playing this together and that is where the game shines at its brightest.... with friends. 

Overall if you don't mind getting tied down and gang banged by a killer for several matches in straight succession, then this is definitely the game for you. 

P.S. Don't forget the spit... you want the spit

For someone that's never gamed before in their life (outside of Mortal Kombat and Sonic back on Sega Genesis), this was one heck of a game to be thrown right into. A friend told me to get it and I'm glad they did. For a new player, the game was easy to learn - not that I'm anywhere close to being a good player. I think I'm fairly decent for how new I am to the game. But learning how to do things in the game is simple, quick to learn, enough to make the game enjoyable - even if you die. And every time you play, you DO feel like you're getting better. Was it scary? Yes, at first. But that's probably because I'm a baby. There are no intentional jump scares, though. So anyone worried about that, rest assured there aren't (though that's dependant on your killer, more or less). The only killer that manages to pop out of nowhere every time for me, is Ghostface. And that's obviously because he's stealth af. You'll get used to the music whenever the killer comes near. It won't be nearly as scary to you the longer you play. I'm not scared at all any more, and this is easily my favourite game to play. And that's saying a lot, especially since (again), I'm not very good at it. Mostly, I like the feeling of accomplishment I get from it when I've played a good match and succeeded at things I didn't used to succeed at before. Which, yes, can be said for any game, but I don't know. There's something about THIS game that makes it different. I haven't gotten bored of it at all. And I've played it every day for the past 2+ weeks. Definitely start as Meg. Definitely play as killer, too -  if for no other reason than to become more acquainted with the maps and seeing how survivors react, so you know how to play survivor better in the future. That's all I've got. This game is great.

Perfect value / playable time if you like this kind of games.
